ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: How to plan out, execute, revise, and present an original research project. But so much more!!! I learned about the ways that I learn and can improve my own learning process, how to structure out my own schedules/syllabi and hold myself accountable for my work, how to support my peers through constructive feedback across a dazzling diverse array of project subjects and formats.
The discipline to take on a year long project
This is the only senior project where you instructors will actually teach you how to do it. You will actually get support lol
I learned all my thesis skills through my time workshopping and talking to my advisers in this class.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The biggest strength was how we had a tight schedule to follow and it was hard to get behind on work with all the due dates.

Although I wasn't sure how it would go, at first, the every-other-week meeting times were quite helpful. That this is a combination seminar and independent study where we check-in/peer edit from time to time actually works great for the set-up. 

One thing: Only because I wanted to take advantage of my peers' brilliance (and develop my own), I would have loved to have a class on thoughtful, effective peer editing. Sometimes I felt as though I wanted a bit more from my peers on my work, and felt that I gave more than I received.
Peer editing was very difficult as were coming from different disciplines and with writing abilities

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Could have changed the course requirements to reflect the fact that we are taking this in a global pandemic! It was a tough year for us all and I wish that there was greater institutional recognition of this, but all the requirements remained exactly the same as previous years.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, absolutely. It was the most challenging but fulfilling project of my time at Yale. It's absolutely worth it. (YALE, IF YOU'RE LISTENING, FUND EDUCATION STUDIES PLEASE!!!! THIS PROGRAM IS REALLY INCREDIBLE, WITH SOME OF THE HARDEST-WORKING STUDENTS AND FACULTY ON CAMPUS PRODUCING GROUNDBREAKING RESEARCH)

If you're an education studies scholar you have to take it. I'd definitely recommend taking this over the self-study if you need some structure to keep you on track and not procrastinating. Overall, I recommend taking the capstone instead of going with the certificate if you can. It was an incredibly tough experience, especially with having to balance it with a thesis for my major (note: this is literally a thesis equivalent) but the ed studies program, and the capstone sequence in particular, is one of the best structured programs to provide you the mentorship, feedback, and training you need to complete a thesis well.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Virtual seminar + meetings outside of class with advisors
